intro: Oscularia, commonly known as the "buttercup daisy," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Oscularia species are typically low-growing, mat-forming plants that thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. They have a shallow root system and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. Many species are popular in rock gardens and xeriscapes due to their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
